snippet: Local oil executives said foreign oil service companies were in the process of quietly removing several hundred workers until they were confident that the security situation was stable.
abstract: Oil service companies are quietly removing several hundred workers from production sites in Algeria that were once considered safe after attack and hostage-taking by militants; foreign oil executives say it is too soon to know if security has broken down in Algerian oil and gas fields, but precautions are being taken until confidence is restored.
lead_paragraph: Local oil executives said foreign oil service companies were in the process of quietly removing several hundred workers until they were confident that the security situation was stable.

headline.seo: At Algerian Oil and Gas Fields, New Fears and Precautions
headline.main: At Algerian Oil and Gas Fields Once Thought Safe, New Fears and Precautions
headline.print_headline: At Algerian Oil and Gas Fields Once Thought Safe, New Fears and Precautions
